subject: Ethics
title: Sovereignty vs Human Rights
description: A 60-second lesson on Sovereignty vs Human Rights.

hook.text: A dictator gasses his own people. He says it's an internal matter. International law kind of agrees.

buildup.text: The Westphalian system says each nation is sovereignâ€”no outside power can interfere in its affairs.

discovery.text: But the Universal Declaration of Human Rights says certain rights transcend borders and governments.

twist.text: Every interventionist power claims human rights. Every dictator claims sovereignty. Both use law as armor.

climax.text: Sovereignty protects weak nations from bullies, but also shields tyrants from justice. That's the tension.

punchline.text: Sovereignty shields nations and tyrants alike. That's the flaw.

quiz.question: What is the core tension between sovereignty and human rights?
options: Human rights only apply within democratic nations, not authoritarian ones
International law has fully resolved the conflict in favor of human rights
Sovereignty protects nations from outside interference but can also shield tyrants from accountability
